Overview.Summary: In the 2014 Lithuanian presidential election, incumbent President Dalia Grybauskaite won a second term on an anti-Russia platform (1). In July of that year, Dainius Žalimas was appointed as head of Lithuania's Constitutional Court (2). Grybauskaite faced a harder fight in the election, with a first round of voting scheduled for May 11 (3, 4, 9). Vice President Joseph Biden and Grybauskaite addressed Russia's intervention in Crimea in a joint statement (5). A referendum was held on June 29, 2014 to change the requirements for altering the Constitution (6). Grybauskaite also met with Biden in March to discuss security measures for the Baltic States (7). The Democratic Union (HDZ) came out ahead in the Croatian general elections, but without an absolute majority (8). The presidential election was held on May 11, 2014 (10).

Timeline.Text: Lithuania holds its presidential election, with Dalia Grybauskaitė being re-elected on an anti-Russia platform.
A referendum is held in Lithuania to change the requirements for altering the constitution.
Dainius Žalimas is appointed as the head of Lithuania's Constitutional Court.
Elections for the European Parliament take place in Lithuania.

Overview.Summary: In May 2014, the first round of voting in the Lithuanian presidential election took place (1, 3). Incumbent president Dalia Grybauskaite was favored to win, but failed to secure an overall majority (3). The final round of voting was held on May 25 (9). In contrast, the 2014 Thai coup d'etat took place on May 22 (2). Other presidential elections that took place in 2014 included those in Slovakia (4), Colombia (5), and Afghanistan (6, 8). Malawi's presidential election was also held in May, with Peter Mutharika being declared the winner (10). The Lithuanian ex-president was banned from participating in future presidential elections and holding certain offices (7).

Timeline.Text: The Lithuanian presidential election takes place, with Dalia Grybauskaite favored to win a second term.
Voting concludes in the Lithuanian presidential election, with Dalia Grybauskaite apparently failing to secure an overall majority.
The results of the Afghan presidential election are announced, with Abdullah Abdullah in the lead.
Colombian presidential candidates will face a runoff election after none achieved an overall majority.
Peter Mutharika, leader of the Democratic Progressive Party and brother of Malawi's former leader, is declared the winner of the country's disputed presidential election.

Overview.Summary: In the 2014 Lithuanian presidential election, incumbent president Dalia Grybauskaite faced a harder fight for re-election (3). She ultimately declared victory (8) and was re-elected for a second term (9). Vice President Joe Biden and President Grybauskaite addressed Russia's intervention in Crimea (2) and discussed security measures for the Baltic States (4). Dainius Zalimas was appointed head of Lithuania's Constitutional Court (5). The election took place on May 11, 2014 (1, 10).

Timeline.Text: Dainius Žalimas is appointed as head of Lithuania's Constitutional Court.
Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. and President Dalia Grybauskaitė of Lithuania address Russia's intervention in Crimea.
President Dalia Grybauskaitė meets with Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. to discuss measures for the security of the Baltic States.
Dalia Grybauskaitė is expected to win the 2014 Lithuanian presidential election, but may not achieve an absolute majority in the first round of voting.
The date for the upcoming Lithuanian presidential election is announced.
Incumbent president Dalia Grybauskaitė casts her ballot at a polling station during the first round of voting in the Lithuanian presidential election.
Elections for the European Parliament will take place in Lithuania.
Dalia Grybauskaitė is re-elected as president of Lithuania.
Dalia Grybauskaitė declares victory in the Lithuanian presidential election.

Overview.Summary: The 2014 Lithuanian presidential election saw the re-election of incumbent president Dalia Grybauskaitė (10). During the election, she discussed measures to ensure the security of the Baltic States with the Vice President of the United States (2) and spoke with other presidents about the situation in Ukraine (4). The election was scheduled for May 11, 2014 (9). The president of Lithuania is elected by all citizens over 18 years old and can serve two consecutive terms (8). A proposed motion on the 2014 referendum sought to change the requirements for altering the Constitution (7). Dainius Žalimas was appointed head of Lithuania's Constitutional Court (3).

Timeline.Text: The first round of the Lithuanian presidential election takes place, with incumbent president Dalia Grybauskaitė facing a tougher fight than in the previous election.
Dalia Grybauskaitė is re-elected as the President of Lithuania, making her the first head of state to be re-elected in the country's history.
The second round of the presidential election takes place, with Grybauskaitė winning with 69.10% of the vote.
A referendum is held to change the requirements for altering the Lithuanian Constitution.
Dainius Žalimas is appointed as the head of Lithuania's Constitutional Court.

Overview.Summary: In the 2014 Lithuanian presidential election, incumbent President Dalia Grybauskaitė emerged as the clear leader (1) and met with Vice President Joe Biden to discuss security measures (2). Grybauskaitė also gave joint statements with Biden on Russia's intervention in Crimea (3) and opened the World Lithuanian Economic Forum (5). She also sent greetings to Lithuanians from space (6). However, she faced a harder fight in the 2014 election (4,7,8) and congratulated the newly elected Slovakian president (9). Grybauskaitė has been critical of Russian President Putin, comparing him to Catherine the Great (10).

Timeline.Text: Vice President Joe Biden and Lithuanian President Dalia Grybauskaitė give joint statements addressing Russia's intervention in Crimea.
President Dalia Grybauskaitė meets with Vice President Joe Biden to discuss measures to ensure the security of the Baltic States.
President Dalia Grybauskaitė prepares for a harder fight in the upcoming presidential election.
President Dalia Grybauskaitė sends greetings to all Lithuanians from space.
President Dalia Grybauskaitė congratulates the newly elected Slovakian President Andrej Kiska.
President Dalia Grybauskaitė emerges as the clear leader in the Lithuanian presidential election, but looks set to face a run-off vote.
President Dalia Grybauskaitė compares Russian President Putin to Catherine the Great.

Overview.Summary: In the 2014 Lithuanian presidential election, incumbent president Dalia Grybauskaite faced a second round run-off after falling short of 50% of the votes needed for re-election (3, 7). Grybauskaite, also known as the "Iron Lady," was ultimately re-elected with an historic victory (2). The election was marked by Grybauskaite's hard line against Russia (4) and her commitment to her fellow countrymen (2). The election was monitored by the OSCE, with a core team of 13 staff and 10 long-term observers deployed throughout the country (6, 8). The election also sparked discussions about potential lifetime bans on former presidents, such as Lithuanian ex-president Rolandas Paksas (10).

Timeline.Text: Dalia Grybauskaite casts her ballot in the first round of voting for the Lithuanian presidential election.
Dalia Grybauskaite leads in the presidential polls but a second round of voting is necessary.
Dalia Grybauskaite wins the presidential election, becoming the first president in Lithuanian history to be re-elected.
The OSCE deploys an Election Support Team to assist with the presidential and provincial council elections in Afghanistan.
Abdul Fattah al-Sisi is declared the winner of the Egyptian presidential election with 93% of the vote.

Overview.Summary: The 2014 Lithuanian presidential election (4,5) was held on May 11 and saw Dalia Grybauskaite reelected (1,4). It was the 7th election since 1990 (3). The election also coincided with the election for the European Parliament (5). The election followed the impeachment of former president Viktor Yanukovych (10) and was moved forward from its original date of March 2015 due to protests (9). There was also an election held in Hungary on April 6, 2014 (2).

Timeline.Text: Hungary holds general elections, with the Alliance of Young Democrats-Civic Union (FIDESZ-MPP) winning with 44.54% of the vote.
Lithuania holds presidential elections, with Dalia Grybauskaite projected to win a second term.
The second round of Lithuania's presidential election is set for May 25th.
Ukraine holds a presidential election, with Petro Symonenko nominated by the Communist Party of Ukraine.
Petro Poroshenko wins Ukraine's presidential election in the first round of voting.
Ukraine's presidential election follows the impeachment of the former president and appointment of Oleksandr Turchynov as interim president.

subjects: Alliance for a Change in Government

Overview.Summary: Incumbent President Dalia Grybauskaite won the 2014 Lithuanian presidential election (1,2). The election was held in the context of growing tensions with Russia (14,16). Grybauskaite emphasized her anti-Russia platform during the campaign (1). The election was seen as a harder fight for Grybauskaite compared to her 2009 victory (7,11,15). She was also praised by US Vice President Joe Biden for her leadership during the crisis in Ukraine (5,6,17). In addition, Grybauskaite opened the World Lithuanian Economic Forum (8) and sent greetings to Lithuanians from space (9). In the end, Grybauskaite won with 57.87% of the vote in the second round (12). The referendum to change the Constitution also took place during the election, but failed due to low voter turnout (18,19).
